en.purpose: To determine the T, N, and M categories and the final TNM stage group for hepatocellular carcinoma of the liver.
en.use:
Use to classify hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) of the liver according to the TNM system based on a minimal set of categorical clinical inputs.

The guideline evaluates the following variables:

- Primary tumor assessability

- Presence or absence of a detectable primary tumor

- Tumor pattern (solitary ≤ 2 cm, solitary > 2 cm with/without vascular invasion, multiple tumors none > 5 cm, multiple tumors any > 5 cm)

- Presence of major vascular invasion, invasion of adjacent organs (except gallbladder), or visceral peritoneum perforation

- Regional lymph node assessability

- Regional lymph node metastasis

- Presence of distant metastasis

Based on these inputs, the guideline assigns:

- T category: TX, T0, T1a, T1b, T2, T3, or T4

- N category: NX, N0, or N1

- M category: M0 or M1

Finally, the guideline determines the TNM stage group:

- Stage IA: T1a N0 M0

- Stage IB: T1b N0 M0

- Stage II: T2 N0 M0

- Stage IIIA: T3 N0 M0

- Stage IIIB: T4 N0 M0

- Stage IVA: Any T N1 M0

- Stage IVB: Any T Any N M1
en.misuse: Not to be used for staging cholangiocarcinoma or other liver malignancies that have separate TNM classifications.
